title: cursor improvements: why stop there?
body:
Massively glad you added some ability to increase cursor size, but why cap it where it is currently capped? why cap it at all? I have all my UI and cursor size settings maxxed and wish they could go higher. The tiny-ass text in chat I've more or less gotten used to, and this cursor thing is definitely helping *a bit*, but I still lose cursor in teamfights all the time. This is probably because I'm on a 4k monitory and colorblind (and find colorblind mode to not help at all...).

Is there a reason it's capped at the size of my pinky nail on a 27" monitor? Why not let it take up whole inches of screen real estate if I wanted it to? While we're at it, why not let me set my cursor to "painfully fuchsia" for greater visibility?{{summoner:13}}

replies.body:
Your first mistake was a 27' 4K monitor. That is the low end of 1440p territory, and stuff is developed with that in mind.

It could probably be uncapped, but it would be more work and more weirdness. Have you tried adjusting it in the config files, though?

So the monitor is also hooked up to my workstation, where it is great for real work stuff but still fits in my limited home office desk space (battlestation also has a second monitor, far more useful to me than one somewhat bigger monitor), but yeah for pure gaming concerns I would've gone bigger and/or high refresh rate.

Your suggestion about digging in the config files was perfect, though ("why didn't I think of that?"), and you can indeed set size over 1.0 (slider max) and have it work.
